data.title: Great pizza!
data.text:
We were spending the night in Gulfport before continuing our trip. We asked the hotel clerks where to get dinner. We wanted something relaxed, easy to get to & good. Tony's Brick Oven was the first thing that came to mind & they were right!
The "Downtown Supreme" pizza was excellent! No skimpy toppings here. Two of us couldn't finish it. The atmosphere was relaxing after a long day of driving & shopping. And the staff was very friendly & attentive. 
I'm ready to plan another trip just to go back. I really want to try the PLT Sandwich!

data.title: Best pizza in town.
data.text: As a New Yorker, I tend to be a pizza snob, and I have to admit this pizza is tasty. The crust is authentic, not doughy and the toppings creative. Try the mozza squares and their home made dressings.

data.title: Lunch special is a great value
data.text: I have eaten at Tony's plenty of times but never came for lunch during the week. $6.95 gets two generous pieces of cheese pizza and a salad. The food is always delicious and the service is just as good as the food:

data.title: Great Find!
data.text: We stopped here before a museum visit in Gulfport.  Having never visited this area I had no restaurant in mind.  Spouse  suggested pizza so we picked the highest rated Trip Advisor suggestion.  What a great place!  Small, comfortable and the food is great!  You can watch the pizza cooking in open brick oven while you wait.  The spinach/ artichoke appetizer was really cheesy and delicious. Our pizza was equally good.  We will make a point of stopping here if we return to the area.

data.title: It was ok
data.text: I only had a cheese pizza and some meatballs for an appetizer. I'd rather have pizza from Brooklyns.It was ok though.

data.title: Good pizza.....
data.text: Great atmosphere and friendly staff.  Decided on fried mozzarella which was very good. Ordered a pizza only one size available with plenty of choices or you can create your own.  Very good will definitely return.

data.title: Decent experience
data.text: The atmosphere is great but the food was only average. Nothing stood out as being great or I have to have this again.  We will and have been back nothing negative to not just not outstanding.

data.title: Enjoy your pizza
data.text: The place is rustic but nice.  The servers are friendly and fast.  We enjoyed watching the chief toss the dough making it larger with each spin in the air.  But down to it our pizza was delicious, the oil and spices on the crust was tasty.

data.title: Best pizza in town!
data.text: Tony's Brick oven is much more then just a pizzeria!  While its gormay pizza is delicious, their other dinner choices are just as delicious!  I also love the atmosphere and great service!

data.title: Nice treat
data.text: My husband and I visited Tony's Brick Oven Pizza during our stay for Crusin The Coast. Everything was great and the food was hot  fresh. We had pizza and cheese sticks. We will be back our next visit.

data.title: Damn good pizza
data.text: Best pizza joint that I have been too in Mississippi/Alabama!!! Our waitress La Tasha was very friendly and went over a lot of the menu items with us. We ended up ordering a build your own pizza which was cooked to perfection. Pizza was very flavorful and the entree salad was really fresh. La Tasha also recommended the Lemon Berry cake which was very good!! Definitely will be going back.

data.title: Cruising the coast
data.text: Excellent pizzas. We eat here every year during cruising the coast. Great quality food. Looking forward to eating here this year too.

data.title: Delicious, Friendly Staff, Wonderful Atmosphere
data.text:
My grandmother, husband, and 3month old son ate here for lunch on a whim. My grandmother needs a walker, and my kid a highchair (for the carseat). The staff here catered to our every need without hesitation. Our waiter, Josh, was amazing. Knowledgeable, helpful, and so nice! 

And the food. I'm not usually a pizza person. I enjoy a good pizza, but not often. We started with the fried mozzarella. Obviously fresh mozzarella, and a crispy, Panko breadcrumb coating. Very good. 

 Main course: We had the downtown supreme pizza (without zucchini because my husband and grandma don't like zucchini). First, there was plenty for the three of us. It would have fed four - 2 slices per person. The crust was flavorful and not greasy. The toppings were delicious, and there was so much awesome cheese....

Dessert: You can't end a good cheat meal without sampling some dessert. We tried the cannoli and the lemon berry marscapone cake. The cannoli was super sweet, but the crust had a spice to it. The lemon cake was a great blend of tart, sweet, and creamy-richness with some powdered sugar on top. These desserts were almost too rich for me, but they were so so so good. Definitely worth trying, and if your sweet tooth can't keep up, there was enough to share with others for sure.

The atmosphere was spacious while still feeling like a cozy place to eat. Good, relaxing music (a healthy assortment of Jimmy Buffet), and the beautiful brick oven was right there for everyone to see. 

Overall, this was a treat for all. I will definitely be coming back! Just need to run a few marathons to work off the meal I just had hahaha. Worth it!

data.title: Very Enjoyable
data.text: Great atmosphere right in downtown.  Good service.  Spinach artichoke dip was a bit different but the flavor was good.  Marg pizza was very good...nice basil flavor.  Chicken Parm sandwich was excellent.   The rustic Italian sandwich... great flavor on the inside... the bread was hard as a brick bat.... thats my only ding here.  Yes, I would go back.

data.title: Food So Good We Went Twice
data.text: Tony's was recommended to us by friends, and we enjoyed it. We tried the Gumbo pizza, and it was very good, although I must say that it probably wouldn't be to everyone's taste.  We went back for a second visit, and this time we tried the Perfect Pepperoni pizza.  It was delicious.  It is a popular place, and the serving staff is attentive and helpful.  They have a large menu, and they have a good selection of beer and a full bar.  We recommend it.

data.title: Great lunch spot
data.text: Very good salads and sandwiches as well as the pizza.      Enjoyed a lunch here and will return again.     Our first time but not our last!

data.title: Fabulous Crust!
data.text: NOT your average chain pizza, this is seriously good food!  They have awesome salads, amazing pizza, and more.  We're so hooked on the pizza and salad we haven't tried the other offerings!

data.title: Great food at a resonable price.
data.text: I love this place. It has great pizza and appetizers.  The prices are very reasonable as well. I have been there many times and will go back again.

data.title: Brick Oven Love
data.text: The sweet young man making the pizzas made sure my 4 year old got to watch him from start to finish, high-flying dough toss and all. She enjoyed sitting at the small bar area watching the fire and her very own pizza go into it. My lunch partner was head-over-heels for the blackened chicken alfredo, and the Mediterranean pizza was 100% the best pizza I have ever eaten. Go there!!

data.title: Local favorite
data.text: An out of the way favorite of the locals. And yes the pizza is hand made and cooked in an authentic brick oven. As it is in the center of downtown Gulfport's business district, please be reminded it will be busy right at noon, but the out of the way spot adds to wonderfully cook food.
